_prev_prog_2.Description: The Fertilizer Manager implements the risk management planning process at this Helena facility.  The Fertilizer Manager is assisted by other Helena staff, as directed.  The Fertilizer Manager is responsible for conducting ammonia process operations in accordance with this RMP and is responsible for the relevant maintenance, training procedures and documentation.  Upon request, Helena will provide a copy of its Risk Management Plan, Contingency Plan, and Operating Procedures to its contractors and auditing agency.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Helena Chemical Company (Helena) is submitting this 5-Year update electronic RMP in compliance with the provisions of the Clean Air Act 112 (r) as codified by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency at 40 CFR Part 68. Standards codified by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration at 29 CFR 1910.119 are not applicable to the operations at this facility because the facility is operated as a retail operation and is exempt from the OSHA standards. This electronic submittal provides conservative estimates of the offsite consequences of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia from the Devol Retail Facility located at Highway 70 and Main Street, Devol, Oklahoma.  The electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Devol Retail Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident. The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Devol Retail Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release (even though a release is unlikely) will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.

PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP

Helena has prepared this RMP as a 5-Year update in accordance with the requirements of 40 CFR Part 68.190.  

FACILITY

The Devol Retail Facility is a retail agricultural chemical facility and consists of approximately 10-acres on which (1) 18,000-gallon and (1) 12,000-gallon storage tanks, (5) 34,000-gallon railcars and (40) 1,000-gallon nurse tanks are located.  Ammonia is transported to this facility via railcar and commercial carrier and transferred to one of the storage tanks.  The process operations conducted by Helena personnel consist of transferring ammonia from the railcar or commercial carrier into the storage tanks, and transfer from the storage tanks into the nurse tanks.  The ammonia is sold to local farmers for direct application.
 
OFF-SITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS

Worst case and alternative consequence analysis were completed for the ammonia storage process. The worst case scenario release for

the Devol Retail Facility assumed that all the contents in (1) 34,000 railcar were released.  The release was modeled as if the railcar tank was punctured on the side at (2) meters above the ground level. The resulting release of ammonia was modeled as an elevated horizontal jet.

The alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario assumes a rupture of a 3-inch line caused by an impact from a vehicle or some other source on the liquid ammonia transfer line during a major loading or unloading operation.  Although this event is classified as an alternative scenario, even an accident of this type is unlikely to occur due to the safety equipment (rail guards, check valves) and operating procedures that Helena uses to safeguard ammonia transfer operations.

The alternative scenario is overly conservative because even a 2-minute release is unlikely to occur since check valves on the system should close immediately upon increased flow resulting from the severed transfer line.

ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM

The Fertilizer Manager implements the risk management planning process at this Helena facility.  The Fertilizer Manager is assisted by other Helena staff, as directed.  The Fertilizer Manager is responsible for conducting ammonia process operations in accordance with this RMP and is responsible for the relevant maintenance, training procedures and documentation.  Upon request, Helena will provide a copy of its Risk Management Plan, Contingency Plan, and Operating Procedures to its contractors and auditing agency.  

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Helena Chemical Company?s Devol Retail Facility is a non-responding facility. Helena has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department. 

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no on-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage; or off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place, in the past five (5) years because of the ammo

nia operations at the Devol Retail Facility.

CONCLUSION

The Risk Management Plan implemented by Helena Chemical Company at the Devol Retail Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Devol Retail Facility adds, deletes, or changes processes. The Emergency Response Program has been coordinated with the Cotton County, OK LEPC.

NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 7 of the standard RMP produced by EPA?s RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Devol Retail Facility.
